node.name: Event
node.description: Something that happens at a given place and time. Elements of this subtree designate the general category in which an event falls.

node.name: Sensory-event
node.description: Something perceivable by the participant. An event meant to be an experimental stimulus should also be tagged with Task-property/Task-role/Experiment-stimulus.

node.name: Agent-action
node.description: Any action engaged in by an agent. An event that is a participant response to an experiment stimulus should also be tagged with Agent-property/Agent-task-role/Participant-response.

node.name: Data-feature
node.description: An event derived from the data itself or possibly inserted in a post-hoc fashion. Examples are markers for interictal spikes or alpha bursts.

node.name: Detected-feature
node.description: Something that is measured or detected by an instrument such as a patch-clamp or a probe.

node.name: Experiment-control
node.description: An event pertaining to the control of the experiment during its operation.

node.name: Experiment-procedure
node.description: An event indicating an experimental procedure as in doing a saliva swab on a participant during the experiment or administering a survey.

node.name: Experiment-structure
node.description: An event specifying the structure of the experiment.

node.name: Agent
node.description: Something in the experiment that takes an active role or produces an effect. The role or effect may be implicit. Being alive or performing an activity such as a computation may qualify something to be an agent. An agent may also be something that simulates something else.

node.name: Animal-agent
node.description: An animal that is present and acting to produce an effect.

node.name: Avatar-agent
node.description: An agent associated with an icon or figure representing a particular person in venues such as video games or internet forums.

node.name: Computational-agent
node.description: An agent whose decisions about its actions can be explained in terms of computation.

node.name: Controller-agent
node.description: An outside controller such as the experimental control software or hardware.

node.name: Human-agent
node.description: A person who takes an active role or produces a specified effect.

node.name: Microscopic-agent
node.description: An agent too small to be seen except under a microscope such as a cell or a neuron.

node.name: Robotic-agent
node.description: An agent that is a mechanical device capable of performing a variety of often complex tasks on command or by being programmed in advance.

node.name: Software-agent
node.description: A computer program that acts for a user or other program in a relationship of agency.

node.name: Action
node.description: Do something.

node.name: Move
node.description: Go in a specified direction or manner; change position.

node.name: Breathe
node.description: Inhale and exhale air into the body during respiration.

node.name: Cough
node.description: Suddenly and audibly expel air from the lungs through a partially closed glottis, preceded by inhalation.

node.name: Exhale
node.description: Blow out or expel breath.

node.name: Hiccup
node.description: Involuntarily spasm the diaphragm and respiratory organs, with a sudden closure of the glottis and a characteristic sound like that of a cough.

node.name: Hold-breath
node.description: Interrupt normal breathing by ceasing to inhale or exhale.

node.name: Inhale
node.description: Draw in with the breath through the nose or mouth.

node.name: Sneeze
node.description: Suddenly and violently expel breath through the nose and mouth.

node.name: Sniffle
node.description: Inhale through nose slightly or repeatedly, typically because of a cold or fit of crying.

node.name: Move-full-body
node.description: Move entire body.

node.name: Bend
node.description: Move body in a bowed or curved manner.

node.name: Dance
node.description: Perform a purposefully selected sequences of human movement often with aesthetic or symbolic value. Move rhythmically to music, typically following a set sequence of steps.

node.name: Fall-down
node.description: Lose balance and collapse.

node.name: Flex
node.description: Cause a muscle to stand out by contracting or tensing it. Bend a limb or joint.

node.name: Jerk
node.description: Make a quick, sharp, sudden movement.

node.name: Recover-balance
node.description: Return to a stable, upright body position.

node.name: Stretch
node.description: Straighten or extend body or a part of body to its full length, typically so as to tighten muscles or in order to reach something.

node.name: Shudder
node.description: Tremble convulsively, sometimes as a result of fear or revulsion.

node.name: Stumble
node.description: Trip or momentarily lose balance and almost fall.

node.name: Turn
node.description: Change or cause to change direction.

node.name: Move-body-part
node.description: Move one part of a body.

node.name: Move-head
node.description: Move head.

node.name: Move-eyes
node.description: Move eyes.

node.name: Blink
node.description: Shut and open the eyes quickly.

node.name: Close-eyes
node.description: Lower and keep eyelids in a closed position.

node.name: Fixate
node.description: Direct eyes to a specific point or target.

node.name: Inhibit-blinks
node.description: Purposely prevent blinking.

node.name: Lift-eyebrows
node.description: Move eyebrows upward.

node.name: Open-eyes
node.description: Raise eyelids to expose pupil.

node.name: Saccade
node.description: Move eyes rapidly between fixation points.

node.name: Stare
node.description: Look fixedly or vacantly at someone or something with eyes wide open.

node.name: Widen-eyes
node.description: Open eyes and possibly with eyebrows lifted especially to express surprise or fear.

node.name: Move-jaw
node.description: Move lower part of the jaw and head.

node.name: Bite
node.description: Seize with teeth or jaws an object or organism so as to grip or break the surface covering.

node.name: Burp
node.description: Noisily release air from the stomach through the mouth; belch.

node.name: Chew
node.description: Repeatedly grinding, tearing, and or crushing with teeth or jaws.

node.name: Clear-throat
node.description: Cough slightly so as to speak more clearly, attract attention, or to express hesitancy before saying something awkward.

node.name: Frown
node.description: Express disapproval, displeasure, or concentration, typically by turning down the corners of the mouth.

node.name: Gurgle
node.description: Make a hollow bubbling sound like that made by water running out of a bottle.

node.name: Smile
node.description: Form facial features into a pleased, kind, or amused expression, typically with the corners of the mouth turned up and the front teeth exposed.

node.name: Swallow
node.description: Cause or allow something, especially food or drink to pass down the throat.

node.name: Yawn
node.description: Take a deep involuntary inhalation with the mouth open often as a sign of drowsiness or boredom.

node.name: Nod-head
node.description: Tilt head in alternating up and down arcs along the sagittal plane. It is most commonly, but not universally, used to indicate agreement, acceptance, or acknowledgement.

node.name: Shake-head
node.description: Turn head from side to side as a way of showing disagreement or refusal.

node.name: Move-arm-hand
node.description: Move some part of arm, shoulder and or arm.

node.name: Clap-hands
node.description: Strike the palms of against one another resoundingly, and usually repeatedly, especially to express approval.

node.name: Drop
node.description: Let or cause to fall vertically.

node.name: Grab
node.description: Seize suddenly or quickly; snatch; clutch.

node.name: Grasp
node.description: Seize and hold firmly.

node.name: Hold-down
node.description: Prevent someone or something from moving by holding them firmly.

node.name: Lift
node.description: Raising something to higher position.

node.name: Make-fist
node.description: Close hand tightly with the fingers bent against the palm.

node.name: Point
node.description: Draw attention to something by extending a finger or arm.

node.name: Press
node.description: Apply pressure to something to flatten, shape, or smooth it.

node.name: Push
node.description: Apply force in order to move something away.

node.name: Reach
node.description: Stretch out your arm in order to get or touch something.

node.name: Release
node.description: Make available; set free.

node.name: Retract
node.description: Draw or pull back.

node.name: Scratch
node.description: Drag claws or nails over a surface or on skin.

node.name: Snap-fingers
node.description: Make a noise by pushing second finger hard against thumb and then releasing it suddenly so that it hits the base of the thumb.

node.name: Touch
node.description: Come into or be in contact with.

node.name: Move-leg-foot
node.description: Move some part of leg or foot.

node.name: Curl-toes
node.description: Bend toes sometimes to grip.

node.name: Jog
node.description: Run at a trot to exercise.

node.name: Jump
node.description: Move off the ground or other surface through sudden muscular effort in the legs.

node.name: Kick
node.description: Strike out or flail with the foot or feet. Strike using the leg, in unison usually with an area of the knee or lower using the foot.

node.name: Pedal
node.description: Move by working the pedals of a bicycle or other machine.

node.name: Run
node.description: Travel on foot at a fast pace.

node.name: Step
node.description: Put one leg in front of the other and shift weight onto it.

node.name: Heel-strike
node.description: Strike the ground with the heel during a step.

node.name: Toe-off
node.description: Push with toe as part of a stride.

node.name: Trot
node.description: Run at a moderate pace, typically with short steps.

node.name: Walk
node.description: Move at a regular pace by lifting and setting down each foot in turn never having both feet off the ground at once.

node.name: Communicate
node.description: Convey knowledge of or information about something.

node.name: Communicate-vocally
node.description: Communicate using mouth or vocal cords.

node.name: Cry
node.description: Shed tears associated with emotions, usually sadness but also joy or frustration.

node.name: Groan
node.description: Make a deep inarticulate sound in response to pain or despair.

node.name: Gulp
node.description: Swallow quickly or in large mouthfuls, often audibly, sometimes to indicate apprehension.

node.name: Laugh
node.description: Make the spontaneous sounds and movements of the face and body that are the instinctive expressions of lively amusement and sometimes also of contempt or derision.

node.name: Scream
node.description: Make loud, vociferous cries or yells to express pain, excitement, or fear.

node.name: Sigh
node.description: Emit a long, deep, audible breath expressing sadness, relief, tiredness, or a similar feeling.

node.name: Speak
node.description: Communicate using spoken language.

node.name: Gesture
node.description: Communicate nonverbally using visible bodily actions, either in place of speech or together and in parallel with spoken words. Gestures include movement of the hands, face, or other parts of the body.

node.name: Index-up
node.description: Raise with fist clenched in triumph or affirmation.

node.name: Pump-fist
node.description: Raise with fist clenched in triumph or affirmation.

node.name: Spread-hands
node.description: Spread hands apart to indicate ignorance.

node.name: Shhh
node.description: Place finger over lips and possibly uttering the syllable shhh to indicate the need to be quiet.

node.name: Shrug
node.description: Lift shoulders up towards head to indicate a lack of knowledge about a particular topic.

node.name: Thumbs-down
node.description: Extend the thumb downward to indicate disapproval.

node.name: Thumb-up
node.description: Extend the thumb upward to indicate approval.

node.name: Wave
node.description: Raise hand and move left and right, as a greeting or sign of departure.

node.name: Communicate-musically
node.description: Communicate using music.

node.name: Hum
node.description: Make a low, steady continuous sound like that of a bee. Sing with the lips closed and without uttering speech.

node.name: Sing
node.description: Produce musical tones by means of the voice.

node.name: Vocalize
node.description: Utter vocal sounds.

node.name: Whistle
node.description: Produce a shrill clear sound by forcing breath out or air in through the puckered lips.

node.name: Perform
node.description: Carry out or accomplish an action, task, or function.

node.name: Collide
node.description: Hit with force when moving.

node.name: Halt
node.description: Bring or come to an abrupt stop.

node.name: Modify
node.description: Change something.

node.name: Operate
node.description: Control the functioning of a machine, process, or system.

node.name: Play
node.description: Engage in activity for enjoyment and recreation rather than a serious or practical purpose.

node.name: Read
node.description: Interpret something that is written or printed.

node.name: Repeat
node.description: Make, do, or perform again.

node.name: Rest
node.description: Be inactive in order to regain strength, health, or energy.

node.name: Write
node.description: Communicate or express by means of letters or symbols written or imprinted on a surface.

node.name: Think
node.description: Direct the mind toward someone or something or use the mind actively to form connected ideas.

node.name: Allow
node.description: Allow access to something such as allowing a car to pass.

node.name: Attend-to
node.description: Focus mental experience on specific targets.

node.name: Count
node.description: Tally items either silently or aloud.

node.name: Deny
node.description: Refuse to give or grant something requested or desired by someone.

node.name: Detect
node.description: Discover or identify the presence or existence of something.

node.name: Discriminate
node.description: Recognize a distinction.

node.name: Encode
node.description: Convert information or an instruction into a particular form.

node.name: Evade
node.description: Escape or avoid, especially by cleverness or trickery.

node.name: Generate
node.description: Cause something, especially an emotion or situation to arise or come about.

node.name: Identify
node.description: Establish or indicate who or what someone or something is.

node.name: Imagine
node.description: Form a mental image or concept of something.

node.name: Judge
node.description: Evaluate evidence to make a decision or form a belief.

node.name: Learn
node.description: Adaptively change behavior as the result of experience.

node.name: Perceive
node.description: Produce an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system.

node.name: Listen
node.description: Give attention to a sound.

node.name: Look
node.description: Direct gaze toward someone or something or in a specified direction.

node.name: Smell
node.description: Inhale in order to ascertain an odor or scent.

node.name: Taste
node.description: Sense of flavor perceived in the mouth and throat on contact with a substance.

node.name: Plan
node.description: Think about the activities required to achieve a desired goal.

node.name: Predict
node.description: Say or estimate that something will happen or will be a consequence of something without having exact informaton.

node.name: Recognize
node.description: Identify someone or something from having encountered them before.

node.name: Respond
node.description: React to something such as a treatment or a stimulus.

node.name: Recall
node.description: Remember information by mental effort.

node.name: Switch-attention
node.description: Transfer attention from one focus to another.

node.name: Track
node.description: Follow a person, animal, or object through space or time.

node.name: Item
node.description: An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).

node.name: Biological-item
node.description: An entity that is biological, that is related to living organisms.

node.name: Organism
node.description: A living entity, more specifically a biological entity that consists of one or more cells and is capable of genomic replication (independently or not).

node.name: Animal
node.description: A living organism that has membranous cell walls, requires oxygen and organic foods, and is capable of voluntary movement.

node.name: Human
node.description: The bipedal primate mammal Homo sapiens.

node.name: Plant
node.description: Any living organism that typically synthesizes its food from inorganic substances and possesses cellulose cell walls.

node.name: Anatomical-item
node.description: A biological structure, system, fluid or other substance excluding single molecular entities.

node.name: Body-part
node.description: Any part of an organism.

node.name: Head
node.description: The upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs.

node.name: Organ
node.description: A unique macroscopic anatomic structure that is composed of various tissues and performs specific functions as for example heart or liver.

node.name: Tissue
node.description: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

node.name: Language-item
node.description: An item that is part of systematic means of communicating by the use of sounds, symbols, or gestures. The presentation of this item is usually visual, auditory or tactile.

node.name: Character
node.description: A mark, sign or symbol used as part of language.

node.name: Glyph
node.description: A symbol or pictograph.

node.name: Nonword
node.description: A group of letters or speech sounds that looks or sounds like a word but that is not accepted as such by native speakers.

node.name: Phoneme
node.description: A sound or a group of different sounds perceived to have the same function by speakers of the language.

node.name: Phrase
node.description: A small group of words standing together as a conceptual unit.

node.name: Sentence
node.description: A set of words that is complete in itself.

node.name: Syllable
node.description: A unit of pronunciation having one vowel sound.

node.name: Textblock
node.description: A block of text.

node.name: Word
node.description: A single distinct meaningful element of a language.

node.name: Object
node.description: Something perceptible by one or more of the senses, especially by vision or touch; a material thing.

node.name: Man-made-object
node.description: A manmade object

node.name: Visualization
node.description: A visual representation of something else -- such as using a stick-figure to represent motion capture data.

node.name: Image
node.description: A still 2-D representation.

node.name: Building
node.description: Whole building or building feature
Value of a keyboard key.
Value of keypad key.

node.name: Document
node.description: A physical, written document

node.name: Furnishing
node.description: Furniture and appliances and other movable accessories including curtains and rugs

node.name: Natural-object
node.description: An object occuring naturally in contrast to a man-made object.

node.name: Mineral
node.description: An inorganic substance

node.name: Natural-feature
node.description: Some terrain occuring in the outdoors.

node.name: Sound
node.description: Mechanical vibrations transmitted by an elastic medium; something that can be heard.

node.name: Environmental-sound
node.description: A background sound from the surrounding environment.

node.name: Crowd-sound
node.description: Multiple speech streams at once.

node.name: Musical-sound
node.description: Any tone or combination of tones with characteristics such as controlled pitch and timbre that can be controlled by an agent.

node.name: Ka-ching
node.description: Cash register sound

node.name: Agent-property
node.description: Something that pertains to an agent.

node.name: Cognitive-state
node.description: The state of the cognitive processes or state of mind of the agent.

node.name: Alert
node.description: Condition of heightened watchfulness or preparation for action.

node.name: Anesthetized
node.description: Having lost sensation to pain or having senses dulled due to the effects of an anesthetic.

node.name: Asleep
node.description: Having entered a periodic, readily reversible state of reduced awareness and metabolic activity, usually accompanied by physical relaxation and brain activity.

node.name: Attentive
node.description: Concentrating and focusing mental energy on the task or surroundings.

node.name: Awake
node.description: In a non sleeping state.

node.name: Brain-dead
node.description: Characterized by the irreversible absence of cortical and brain stem functioning.

node.name: Comatose
node.description: In a state of profound unconsciousness associated with markedly depressed cerebral activity.

node.name: Drowsy
node.description: In a state of near-sleep, a strong desire for sleep, or sleeping for unusually long periods.

node.name: Intoxicated
node.description: In a state with disturbed psychophysiological functions and responses as a result of administration or ingestion of a psychoactive substance.

node.name: Locked-in
node.description: In a state of complete paralysis of all voluntary muscles except for the ones that control the movements of the eyes.

node.name: Passive
node.description: Not responding or initiating an action in response to a stimulus.

node.name: Resting
node.description: A state in which the agent is not exhibiting any physical exertion.

node.name: Vegetative
node.description: A state of wakefulness and conscience, but (in contrast to coma) with involuntary opening of the eyes and movements (such as teeth grinding, yawning, or thrashing of the extremities).

node.name: Emotional-state
node.description: The status of the general temperament and outlook of an agent.

node.name: Angry
node.description: Experiencing emotions characterized by marked annoyance or hostility.

node.name: Aroused
node.description: In a state reactive to stimuli leading to increased heart rate and blood pressure, sensory alertness, mobility and readiness to respond.

node.name: Awed
node.description: Filled with wonder. Feeling grand, sublime or powerful emotions characterized by a combination of joy, fear, admiration, reverence, and/or respect.

node.name: Compassionate
node.description: Feeling or showing sympathy and concern for others often evoked for a person who is in distress and associated with altruistic motivation.

node.name: Content
node.description: Feeling satisfaction with things as they are.

node.name: Disgusted
node.description: Feeling revulsion or profound disapproval aroused by something unpleasant or offensive.

node.name: Emotionally-neutral
node.description: Feeling neither satisfied nor dissatisfied.

node.name: Empathetic
node.description: Understanding and sharing the feelings of another. Being aware of, being sensitive to, and vicariously experiencing the feelings, thoughts, and experience of another.

node.name: Excited
node.description: Feeling great enthusiasm and eagerness.

node.name: Fearful
node.description: Feeling apprehension that one may be in danger.

node.name: Frustrated
node.description: Feeling annoyed as a result of being blocked, thwarted, disappointed or defeated.

node.name: Grieving
node.description: Feeling sorrow in response to loss, whether physical or abstract.

node.name: Happy
node.description: Feeling pleased and content.

node.name: Jealous
node.description: Feeling threatened by a rival in a relationship with another individual, in particular an intimate partner, usually involves feelings of threat, fear, suspicion, distrust, anxiety, anger, betrayal, and rejection.

node.name: Joyful
node.description: Feeling delight or intense happiness.

node.name: Loving
node.description: Feeling a strong positive emotion of affection and attraction.

node.name: Relieved
node.description: No longer feeling pain, distress, anxiety, or reassured.

node.name: Sad
node.description: Feeling grief or unhappiness.

node.name: Stressed
node.description: Experiencing mental or emotional strain or tension.

node.name: Postural-state
node.description: Pertaining to the position in which agent holds their body.

node.name: Crouching
node.description: Adopting a position where the knees are bent and the upper body is brought forward and down, sometimes to avoid detection or to defend oneself.

node.name: Kneeling
node.description: Positioned where one or both knees are on the ground.

node.name: On-treadmill
node.description: Ambulation on an exercise apparatus with an endless moving belt to support moving in place.

node.name: Prone
node.description: Positioned in a recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its stomach and faces downward.

node.name: Sitting
node.description: In a seated position.

node.name: Standing
node.description: Assuming or maintaining an erect upright position.

node.name: Supported-by-chin-rest
node.description: Using a device that supports the chin and head.

node.name: Agent-trait
node.description: A genetically, environmentally, or socially determined characteristic of an agent.

node.name: Age
node.description: Length of time elapsed time since birth of the agent.

node.name: Gender
node.description: Characteristics that are socially constructed, including norms, behaviors, and roles based on sex.

node.name: Sex
node.description: Physical properties or qualities by which male is distinguished from female.

node.name: Female
node.description: Biological sex of an individual with female sexual organs such ova.

node.name: Male
node.description: Biological sex of an individual with male sexual organs producing sperm.

node.name: Intersex
node.description: Having genitalia and/or secondary sexual characteristics of indeterminate sex.

node.name: Handedness
node.description: Individual preference for use of a hand, known as the dominant hand.

node.name: Left-handed
node.description: Preference for using the left hand or foot for tasks requiring the use of a single hand or foot.

node.name: Right-handed
node.description: Preference for using the right hand or foot for tasks requiring the use of a single hand or foot.

node.name: Ambidextrous
node.description: Having no overall dominance in the use of right or left hand or foot in the performance of tasks that require one hand or foot.

node.name: Agent-social-role
node.description: The function or part that is ascribed to an individual agent with respect to in a community.

node.name: Brother
node.description: Being a male sibling.

node.name: Child
node.description: Having an age below the legal age of majority.

node.name: Father
node.description: Being a male parent.

node.name: Mother
node.description: Being a female parent.

node.name: Sister
node.description: Being a female sibling.

node.name: Agent-task-role
node.description: The function or part that is ascribed to an agent in performing the task.

node.name: Experimental-controller
node.description: An agent acting to control the experiment.

node.name: Experimental-participant
node.description: Someone who takes part in an activity related to an experiment.

node.name: Experimenter
node.description: Person who is the owner of the experiment and has its responsibility.

node.name: Follower
node.description: A person who follows the lead of another.

node.name: Friend
node.description: A person whom an individual knows, likes, and trusts.

node.name: Leader
node.description: A person who leads or commands an activity, project, group, organization, or country.

node.name: Stranger
node.description: A person not known in a particular place or community.

node.name: Student
node.description: A person who is enrolled in an educational institution. A person who acquires knowledge and skill from some educator during an education process.

node.name: Teacher
node.description: An agent who instructs or educates others.

node.name: Data-property
node.description: Something that pertains to data or information.

node.name: Data-source-type
node.description: The type of place, person, or thing from which the data comes or can be obtained.

node.name: Computed-feature
node.description: A feature computed from the data by a tool. This tag should be grouped with a label of the form Toolname_propertyName.

node.name: Computed-prediction
node.description: A computed extrapolation of known data.

node.name: Expert-annotation
node.description: An explanatory or critical comment or other in-context information provided by an authority.

node.name: Instrument-measurement
node.description: Information obtained from a device that is used to measure material properties or make other observations.

node.name: Observation
node.description: Active acquisition of information from a primary source. Should be grouped with a label of the form AgentID_featureName.

node.name: Physical-property
node.description: A characteristic that defines the nature of matter or forces that act upon it.

node.name: Electromagnetic-property
node.description: A characteristic of matter such as electrical conductivity that governs its interaction with electrical or magnetic forces.

node.name: Mechanical-property
node.description: A physical quality that inheres in an bearer by virtue of how that bearer behaves when subjected to forces or displacements and the effect of their bodies on their environment.

node.name: Pressure
node.description: The force applied to a unit area of surface.

node.name: Organic-property
node.description: Relating to or containing elemental carbon or carbon compounds.

node.name: Thermodynamic-property
node.description: Property related to heat and other forms of energy (such as mechanical, electrical, or chemical energy), and, by extension, of the relationships between all forms of energy.

node.name: Energy
node.description: The capacity of a physical system to do work.

node.name: Entropy
node.description: A thermodynamic property which acts as a measure of the state of disorder of a system.

node.name: Temperature
node.description: A measure of the average kinetic energy of a system of particles. Temperature may be quantified, in the context of thermodynamics, as the potential of one system to transfer thermal energy to another system until both systems reach a state of thermal equilibrium.

node.name: Quantitative-property
node.description: Something capable of being estimated or expressed with numeric values.

node.name: Angle
node.description: The inclination of one line to another or the plane of one object to another. Angles are assumed clockwise from vertical unless grouped with axis.

node.name: Fraction
node.description: A numerical value betwee 0 and 1.

node.name: Interval
node.description: A period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.

node.name: Item-count
node.description: An integer and represented the number of instances or occurences of an entity.

node.name: Percentage
node.description: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

node.name: Ratio
node.description: A quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

node.name: Repetition-interval
node.description: The amount of time between successive occurrences.

node.name: Repetition-number
node.description: An integer that identifies the particular occurrence of a repeating activity or entity.

node.name: Spatiotemporal-property
node.description: A property relating to space and/or time.

node.name: Rate-of-change
node.description: The amount of change accumulated per unit time.

node.name: Acceleration
node.description: Magnitude of the rate of change in either speed or direction. The direction of change should be given separately.

node.name: Jerk-rate
node.description: Magnitude of the rate at which the acceleration of an object changes with respect to time. The direction of change should be given separately.

node.name: Sampling-rate
node.description: The number of digital samples taken or recorded per unit of time.

node.name: Refresh-rate
node.description: The frequency with which the image on a computer monitor or similar electronic display screen is refreshed, usually expressed in hertz.

node.name: Speed
node.description: A scalar measure of the rate of movement of the object expressed either as the distance travelled divided by the time taken (average speed) or the rate of change of position with respect to time at a particular point (instantaneous speed). The direction of change should be given separately.

node.name: Resolution
node.description: The size of the smallest element that can be separated from neighboring elements.

node.name: IO-resolution
node.description: Smallest change in a quality being measured by an sensor that causes a perceptible change in the IO device.

node.name: Screen-resolution
node.description: Resolution of a screen, usually expressed as the of pixels in a dimension for a digital display device.

node.name: Printer-resolution
node.description: Resolution of a printer, usually expressed as the number of dots-per-inch for a printer.

node.name: Spatial-resolution
node.description: Linear spacing of a spatial measurement.

node.name: Spectral-resolution
node.description: Measures the ability of a sensor to resolve features in the electromagnetic spectrum.

node.name: Temporal-resolution
node.description: Measures the ability of a sensor to resolve features in time.

node.name: Spatial-property
node.description: Property of an element involving space.

node.name: Direction
node.description: The spatial relation between something and the course along which it points or moves.

node.name: Distance
node.description: A measure of the space separating two objects or points.

node.name: Orientation
node.description: The position or alignment of something relative to points of the compass, other specific directions, or some other indexing system.

node.name: Position
node.description: A reference to the alignment of an object, a particular situation or view of a situation, or the location of an object. Coordinates with respect a specified frame of reference or the default Screen-frame if no frame is given.

node.name: X-position
node.description: The position along the x-axis of the frame of reference.

node.name: Y-position
node.description: The position along the y-axis of the frame of reference.

node.name: Z-position
node.description: The position along the z-axis of the frame of reference.

node.name: Size
node.description: The physical magnitude of something.

node.name: Area
node.description: The extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.

node.name: Length
node.description: The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.

node.name: Width
node.description: The extent or measurement of something from side to side.

node.name: Height
node.description: The vertical measurement or distance from the base to the top of an object; the vertical dimension of extension.

node.name: Volume
node.description: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

node.name: Surface-properties
node.description: Property of the outer boundary of a three-dimensional object.

node.name: Rough
node.description: A texture quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the irregular surface of the bearer.

node.name: Smooth
node.description: Having a surface free from roughness or bumps or ridges or irregularities.

node.name: Temporal-property
node.description: A characteristic of or relating to time or limited by time.

node.name: Delay
node.description: Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time.

node.name: Duration
node.description: The period of time during which something occurs or continues.

node.name: Frequency
node.description: Frequency is the number of occurrences of a repeating event per unit time.

node.name: Onset
node.description: Labels the start or beginning of something, usually an event.

node.name: Offset
node.description: Labels the time at which something stops.

node.name: Pause
node.description: Indicates the temporary interruption of the operation a process and subsequently wait for a signal to continue.

node.name: Time-value
node.description: A value with units of time. Usually grouped with tags identifying what the value represents.

node.name: Time-out
node.description: A cancellation or cessation that automatically occurs when a predefined interval of time has passed without a certain event occurring.

node.name: Time-sync
node.description: A synchronization signal whose purpose to help synchronize different signals or processes. Often used to indicate a marker inserted into the recorded data to allow post hoc synchronization of concurrently recorded data streams.

node.name: Statistical-property
node.description: A property relating to, based on, or employing the principles of statistics.

node.name: Accuracy
node.description: A measure of closeness to true value expressed as a number between 0 and 1.

node.name: Data-mean
node.description: The sum of a set of values divided by the number of values in the set.

node.name: Data-median
node.description: The value which has an equal number of values greater and less than it.

node.name: Data-minimum
node.description: The smallest possible quantity.

node.name: Data-maximum
node.description: The largest possible quantity or degree.

node.name: Probability
node.description: A measure of the expectation of the occurrence of a particular event.

node.name: Statistical-precision
node.description: A quantitative representation of the degree of accuracy necessary for or associated with a particular action.

node.name: Statistical-recall
node.description: Sensitivity is a measurement datum qualifying a binary classification test and is computed by substracting the false negative rate to the integral numeral 1.

node.name: Standard-deviation
node.description: A measure of the range of values in a set of numbers. Standard deviation is a statistic used as a measure of the dispersion or variation in a distribution, equal to the square root of the arithmetic mean of the squares of the deviations from the arithmetic mean.

node.name: Uncertainty
node.description: A measure of the inherent variability of repeated observation measurements of a quantity including quantities evaluated by statistical methods and by other means.

node.name: Task-property
node.description: Something that pertains to a task.

node.name: Task-attentional-strategy
node.description: Strategy for allocating attention toward goal-relevant information.

node.name: Bottom-up-attention
node.description: Attentional guidance purely by externally driven factors to stimuli that are salient because of their inherent properties relative to the background. Sometimes this is referred to as stimulus driven.

node.name: Covert-attention
node.description: Paying attention without moving the eyes.

node.name: Divided-attention
node.description: Integrating parallel multiple stimuli. Behavior involving responding simultaneously to multiple tasks or multiple task demands.

node.name: Focused-attention
node.description: Responding discretely to specific visual, auditory, or tactile stimuli.

node.name: Orienting-attention
node.description: Directing attention to a target stimulus.

node.name: Overt-attention
node.description: Selectively processing one location over others by moving the eyes to point at that location.

node.name: Selective-attention
node.description: Maintaining a behavioral or cognitive set in the face of distracting or competing stimuli. Ability to pay attention to a limited array of all available sensory information.

node.name: Sustained-attention
node.description: Maintaining a consistent behavioral response during continuous and repetitive activity.

node.name: Top-down-attention
node.description: Voluntary allocation of attention to certain features. Sometimes this is referred to goal-oriented attention.

node.name: Task-effect-evidence
node.description: The evidence supporting the conclusion that the event had the specified effect.

node.name: Computational-evidence
node.description: A type of evidence in which data are produced, and/or generated, and/or analyzed on a computer.

node.name: External-evidence
node.description: A phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

node.name: Intended-effect
node.description: A phenomenon that is intended to follow and be caused by some previous phenomenon.

node.name: Behavioral-evidence
node.description: An indication or conclusion based on the behavior of an agent.

node.name: Task-event-role
node.description: The purpose of an event with respect to the task.

node.name: Activity
node.description: Something that is part of the overall task or is necessary to the overall experiment but is not directly part of a stimulus-response cycle. Examples would be taking a survey or provided providing a silva sample.

node.name: Background-subtask
node.description: A part of the task which should be performed in the background as for example inhibiting blinks due to instruction while performing the primary task.

node.name: Experimental-stimulus
node.description: Part of something designed to elicit a response in the experiment.

node.name: Failure
node.description: A descriptor indicating a failure.

node.name: Incidental
node.description: Usually associated with a sensory event intended to give instructions to the participant about the task or behavior.

node.name: Instructional
node.description: Usually associated with a sensory event intended to give instructions to the participant about the task or behavior.

node.name: Mishap
node.description: Unplanned disruption such as an equipment or experiment control abnormality or experimenter error.

node.name: Participant-response
node.description: Something related to a participant actions in performing the task.

node.name: Primary-subtask
node.description: A part of the task which should be the primary focus of the participant.

node.name: Warning
node.description: Something that should warn the participant that the parameters of the task have been or are about to be exceeded such as a warning message about getting too close to the shoulder of the road in a driving task.

node.name: Task-response-type
node.description: How the participant response should be interpreted in terms of the task specification.

node.name: Appropriate
node.description: Suitable or proper in the circumstances.

node.name: Correction
node.description: Offering an improvement to replace a mistake; setting right; something substituted for an error.

node.name: Erroneous
node.description: Something wrong or incorrect.

node.name: Imagined
node.description: Form a mental image or concept of something. This is used to identity something that only happened in the imagination of the participant as in imagined movements in motor imagery paradigms.

node.name: Inappropriate
node.description: Not in keeping with what is correct or proper.

node.name: Indeterminate
node.description: Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context.

node.name: Missed
node.description: Not existing; not able to be found.

node.name: Near-miss
node.description: A narrowly avoided collision or other accident.

node.name: Successful
node.description: Something that accomplishes its intended purpose.

node.name: Task-stimulus-role
node.description: The role the stimulus plays in the task.

node.name: Cue
node.description: A signal for an action, a pattern of stimuli indicating a particular response.

node.name: Distractor
node.description: A person or thing that distracts or a plausible but incorrect option in a multiple-choice question.

node.name: Expected
node.description: Considered likely or probable; anticipated. Something of low information value as in frequent non-targets in an RSVP paradigm.

node.name: Extraneous
node.description: Irrelevant or unrelated to the subject being dealt with.

node.name: Feedback
node.description: An evaluative response to an inquiry, process, event, or activity.

node.name: Go-signal
node.description: An indicator to proceed with a planned action.

node.name: Meaningful
node.description: Conveying significant or relevant information.

node.name: Newly-learned
node.description: Representing recently acquired information or understanding.

node.name: Non-informative
node.description: Something that is not useful in forming an opinion or judging an outcome.

node.name: Non-target
node.description: Something other than that done or looked for. Also tag Expected if the Non-target is frequent.

node.name: Not-meaningful
node.description: Not having a serious, important, or useful quality or purpose.

node.name: Novel
node.description: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.

node.name: Oddball
node.description: Something strange, bizarre, unusal, or infrequent.

node.name: Planned
node.description: Something that was decided on or arranged in advance.

node.name: Penalty
node.description: A disadvantage, loss, or hardship due to some action.

node.name: Priming
node.description: An implicit memory effect in which exposure to a stimulus influences response to a later stimulus.

node.name: Reward
node.description: A positive reinforcement for a desired action, behavior or response.

node.name: Stop-signal
node.description: An indicator that the agent should stop the current activity.

node.name: Target
node.description: Something fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination. Something an agent is looking for.

node.name: Threat
node.description: An indicator that signifies hostility and predicts an increased probability of attack.

node.name: Timed
node.description: Something planned or scheduled to be done at a particular time or lasting for a specified amount of time.

node.name: Unexpected
node.description: Something that is not planned or anticipated.

node.name: Attribute
node.description: A characteristic of some entity. A quality or feature regarded as a characteristic or inherent part of someone or something. HED attributes are adjectives or adverbs.

node.name: Informational
node.description: A quality that pertains to information.

node.name: Def
node.description: A HED-specific utility tag used with a defined name to represent the tags associated with that definition.

node.name: Def-expand
node.description: A HED specific utility tag that is grouped with an expanded definition. The child value of the Def-expand is the name of the expanded definition.

node.name: Definition
node.description: A HED-specific utility tag whose child value is the name of the concept and the tag group associated with the tag is an English language explanation of a concept.

node.name: Description
node.description: An explanation of what the tag group it is in means. If the description is at the top-level of an event string, the description applies to the event.

node.name: Experimental-note
node.description: A brief written record about the experiment.

node.name: ID
node.description: An alphanumeric name that identifies either a unique object or a unique class of objects. Here the object or class may be an idea, physical countable object (or class), or physical uncountable substance (or class).

node.name: Label
node.description: A string of 20 or fewer characters identifying something. Labels usually refer to general classes of things while IDs refer to specific instances. A term that is associated with some entity. A brief description given for purposes of identification; an identifying or descriptive marker that is attached to an object.

node.name: Metadata
node.description: Data about data; information that describes another set of data.

node.name: CogAtlas
node.description: The Cognitive Atlas ID number of somthing.

node.name: CogPo
node.description: The CogPO ID number of something.

node.name: Creation-date
node.description: The date on which data creation of this element began.

node.name: Library-name
node.description: Official name of a HED library.

node.name: Pathname
node.description: The specification of a node (file or directory) in a hierarchical file system, usually specified by listing the nodes top-down.

node.name: Subject-identifier
node.description: A sequence of characters used to identify, name, or characterize a trial or study subject.

node.name: Version-identifier
node.description: An alphanumeric character string that identifies a form or variant of a type or original.
Usually is a semantic version.

node.name: Parameter
node.description: Any factor that defines a system and determines or limits its performance. A variable whose value changes the characteristics of a system or a function.

node.name: Value
node.description: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed. Non-numeric values are specified with the Label tag.

node.name: Organizational
node.description: Relating to an organization or the action of organizing something.

node.name: Collection
node.description: A tag designating a grouping of items such as in a set or list.

node.name: Control-variable
node.description: An aspect of the experiment that is fixed throughout the study and usually is explicitly controlled.

node.name: Event-context
node.description: A special HED tag inserted as part of a top-level tag group to contain information about the interrelated conditions under which the event occurs. The event context includes information about other events that are ongoing when this event happens.

node.name: Event-stream
node.description: An ordered list of events.

node.name: Experimental-condition
node.description: An aspect of the experiment or task that is to be varied during the experiment. Task-conditions are sometimes called independent variables or contrasts.

node.name: Experimental-indicator
node.description: An aspect of the experiment or task that is measured as task conditions are varied during the experiment. Experiment indicators are sometimes called dependent variables.

node.name: Experimental-intertrial
node.description: A tag used to indicate a part of the experiment between trials usually where nothing is happening.

node.name: Experimental-trial
node.description: Designates a run or execution of an activity, for example, one execution of a script. A tag used to indicate a particular organizational part in the experimental design often containing a stimulus-response pair or stimulus-response-feedback triad.

node.name: Permutation
node.description: A set of elements are rearranged or reindexed in various and different orders. In the rearrangement process, none of the elements are lost, added, or changed.

node.name: Recording
node.description: The process of copying the information in a signal into a persistent information bearer. Indicates an uninterrupted block of time during which data was acquired using a fixed scanning protocol or sensor positioning. Recording tags are usually have temporal scope which is the entire recording.

node.name: Task
node.description: An assigned piece of work, usually with a time allotment. A tag used to indicate a linkage the structured activities performed as part of the experiment.

node.name: Time-block
node.description: A tag used to indicate a contiguous time block in the experiment during which something is fixed or noted.

node.name: Relational
node.description: Concerns the way in which two or more people or things are connected.

node.name: Comparative-relation
node.description: Something considered in comparison to something else.

node.name: Less-than
node.description: (A (Less-than B)) indicates that the relative size or order of A is smaller than that of B.

node.name: Less-than-or-equal-to
node.description: (A (Less-than-or-equal-to B)) indicates that the relative size or order of A is smaller than or equal to B.

node.name: Greater-than
node.description: (A (Greater-than B)) indicates that the relative size or order of A is bigger than that of B.

node.name: Greater-than-or-equal-to
node.description: (A (Greater-than-or-equal-to B)) indicates that the relative size or order of A is bigger than or the same as that of B.

node.name: Equal-to
node.description: (A (Equal-to B)) indicates that the size or order of A is the same as that of B.

node.name: Not-equal-to
node.description: (A (Not-equal-to B)) indicates that the size or order of A is not the same as that of B.

node.name: Connective-relation
node.description: Indicates two items are related in some way.

node.name: Belongs-to
node.description: (A (Belongs-to B)) indicates that A is a member of B.

node.name: Connected-to
node.description: (A (Connected-to) B) indicates that A is related to B in some respect, usually through a direct link.

node.name: Contained-in
node.description: (A (Contained-in B)) indicates that A is completely inside of B.

node.name: Described-by
node.description: (A (Described-by B)) indicates that B provides information about A.

node.name: From-to
node.description: (A (From-to B)) indicates a directional relation from A to B. A is considered the source.

node.name: Group-of
node.description: (A (Group-of B)) indicates A is a group of items of type B.

node.name: Implied-by
node.description: (A (Implied-by B)) indicates B is suggested by A.

node.name: Interacts-with
node.description: (A (Interacts-with B)) indicates A and B interact, possibly reciprocally.

node.name: Member-of
node.description: (A (Member-of B)) indicates A is a member of group B.

node.name: Part-of
node.description: (A (Part-of B)) indicates A is a part of the whole B.

node.name: Performed-by
node.description: (A (Performed-by B)) Indicates that ction or procedure A was carried out by agent B.

node.name: Related-to
node.description: (A (Relative-to B)) indicates A is a part of the whole B.

node.name: Ordering-relation
node.description: A relation describing the systematic arrangement of data items.

node.name: Early-item
node.description: An item near the beginning of a course, process, or series.

node.name: First-item
node.description: A first item at the beginning of a course, process, or series.

node.name: Next-item
node.description: A subsequent or immediately following item in the order.

node.name: Later-item
node.description: An item occurring near the end of a group of ordered items.

node.name: Last-item
node.description: An item occurring at the end of a group of ordered items.

node.name: Quantitative-relation
node.description: A quantitative or numerical relationship.

node.name: Estimated
node.description: Calculated approximately.

node.name: Approximated
node.description: Not quite exact or correct; almost exact or correct.

node.name: Exact
node.description: Marked by strict and particular and complete accordance with fact.

node.name: Spatiotemporal-relation
node.description: A space and or temporal relationship.

node.name: Directional-relation
node.description: A relationship indicating direction.

node.name: Away-from
node.description: Go away from (a place).

node.name: Backward
node.description: Directed behind or to the rear.

node.name: Closing
node.description: Not affording passage or access; blocked against entry.

node.name: Decreasing
node.description: Becoming smaller or fewer in size, amount, intensity, or degree.

node.name: Downward
node.description: Moving or leading toward a lower place or level.

node.name: Forward
node.description: At or near or directed toward the front.

node.name: Increasing
node.description: Becoming greater in size, amount, or degree; growing.

node.name: Leftward
node.description: Going toward or facing the left.

node.name: Rightward
node.description: Going toward or situated on the right.

node.name: Opening
node.description: Widening an aperture, door, or gap, especially one allowing access.

node.name: Towards
node.description: Moving in the direction of.

node.name: Upward
node.description: Moving, pointing, or leading to a higher place, point, or level.

node.name: Orientational-relation
node.description: Indicating relative physical position or direction of something.

node.name: Horizontally-oriented
node.description: Oriented parallel to or in the plane of the horizon.

node.name: Oblique
node.description: Slanting or inclined in direction or course or position; neither parallel nor perpendicular nor right-angular.

node.name: Rotated
node.description: Move or cause to move in a circle around an axis or center.

node.name: Vertically-oriented
node.description: Oriented in an upright in position or posture.

node.name: Positional-relation
node.description: Indicating information about position.

node.name: Above
node.description: (A (Adjacent-to B)) means A is in a place or position that is higher than B.

node.name: Across-from
node.description: (A (Across-from B)) means A is on the opposite side of something from B.

node.name: Adjacent-to
node.description: (A (Adjacent-to B)) indicates that A is next to B in time or space.

node.name: Ahead-of
node.description: (A (Ahead-of B)) indicates that A is further forward in time or space in B.

node.name: Around
node.description: (A (Around B)) means A is in or near the present place or situation of B.

node.name: Behind
node.description: (A (Behind B)) means A is at or to the far side of B, typically so as to be hidden by it.

node.name: Below
node.description: (A (Below B)) means A is in a place or position that is lower than the position of B.

node.name: Between
node.description: (A (Between, (B, C))) means A is in the space or interval separating B and C.

node.name: Bilateral
node.description: (A (Bilateral B)) means A is on both sides of B or affects both sides of B.

node.name: Bottom-of
node.description: (A (Bottom-of B)) means A is on the lowest part, side, or surface of B.

node.name: Boundary-of
node.description: (A (Boundary-of B)) means A is on or part of the edge or boundary of B.

node.name: Center-of
node.description: (A (Center-of B)) means A is at a point or or in an area that is approximately central within B.

node.name: Close-to
node.description: (A (Close-to B)) means A is at a small distance from or is located near in space to B.

node.name: Far-from
node.description: (A (Far-from B)) means A is at a large distance from or is not located near in space to B.

node.name: In-front-of
node.description: (A (In-front-of B)) means A is in a position just ahead or at the front part of B, potentially partially blocking B from view.

node.name: Left-of
node.description: (A (Left-of B)) means A is located on or directed toward the side to the west of B when B is facing north. This term is used when A is not part of B.

node.name: Left-side
node.description: (A (Left-side B)) means A is located on the left side of B usually as part of B.

node.name: Outside-of
node.description: (A (Outside-of B)) means A is located in the space around but not including B.

node.name: Over
node.description: (A (over B)) means A above is above B so as to cover or protect or A extends over the a general area as from a from a vantage point.

node.name: Right-of
node.description: (A (Right-of B)) means A is located on or directed toward the side to the east of B when B is facing north. This term is used when A is not part of B.

node.name: Right-side
node.description: (A (Right-side B)) means A is located on the right side of B usually as part of B.

node.name: Top-of
node.description: (A (Top-of B)) means A is on the uppermost part, side, or surface of B.

node.name: Underneath
node.description: (A (Underneath B)) means A is situated directly below and may be concealed by B.

node.name: Within
node.description: (A (Within B)) means A is on the inside of or contained in B.

node.name: Temporal-relation
node.description: Any relationship which includes a temporal or time-based component.

node.name: After
node.description: (A After B) means A happens at a time subsequent to a reference time related to B.

node.name: Asynchronous-with
node.description: (A Asynchronous-with B) means A happens at times not occurring at the same time or having the same period or phase as B.

node.name: Before
node.description: (A Before B) means A happens at a time earlier in time or order than B.

node.name: During
node.description: (A During B) means A happens at some point in a given period of time in which B is ongoing.

node.name: Synchronous-with
node.description: (A Synchronous-with B) means A happens at occurs at the same time or rate as B.

node.name: Waiting-for
node.description: (A Waiting-for B) means A pauses for something to happen in B.

node.name: Variability-relation
node.description: An attribute describing how something changes or varies.

node.name: Abrupt
node.description: Marked by sudden change.

node.name: Constant
node.description: Continually recurring or continuing without interruption. Not changing in time or space.

node.name: Continuous
node.description: Uninterrupted in time, sequence, substance, or extent.

node.name: Deterministic
node.description: No randomness is involved in the development of the future states of the element.

node.name: Discrete
node.description: Constituting a separate entities or parts.

node.name: Flickering
node.description: Moving irregularly or unsteadily or burning or shining fitfully or with a fluctuating light.

node.name: Fractal
node.description: Having extremely irregular curves or shapes for which any suitably chosen part is similar in shape to a given larger or smaller part when magnified or reduced to the same size.

node.name: Random
node.description: Governed by or depending on chance; lacking any definite plan or order or purpose.

node.name: Repetitive
node.description: A recurring action that is often non-purposeful.

node.name: Stochastic
node.description: Uses a random probability distribution or pattern that may be analysed statistically but may not be predicted precisely to determine future states.

node.name: Varying
node.description: Differing in size, amount, degree, or nature.

node.name: Thermal-relation
node.description: A relationship related to temperature.

node.name: Cold
node.description: Characterized by an absence of heat.

node.name: Colder-than
node.description: (A (Colder-than B)) means A has less heat energy than the object against which it is compared; the absence of heat.

node.name: Hot
node.description: Characterized by an excess of heat.

node.name: Hotter-than
node.description: (A (Hotter-than B)) means A has more heat energy than the object against which it is compared; the absence of heat.

node.name: Categorical
node.description: Indicates that something can take on a limited and usually fixed number of possible values.

node.name: Categorical-class
node.description: Categorical values that fall into discrete classes such as true or false. The grouping is absolute in the sense that it is the same for all participants.

node.name: All
node.description: To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent.

node.name: Correct
node.description: Free from error; especially conforming to fact or truth.

node.name: Explicit
node.description: Stated clearly and in detail, leaving no room for confusion or doubt.

node.name: False
node.description: Not in accordance with facts, reality or definitive criteria.

node.name: Implicit
node.description: Implied though not plainly expressed.

node.name: Invalid
node.description: Not true because based on erroneous information or unsound reasoning or not conforming to the correct format or specifications.

node.name: None
node.description: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

node.name: Some
node.description: At least a small amount or number of, but not a large amount of, or often.

node.name: True
node.description: Conforming to facts, reality or definitive criteria.

node.name: Valid
node.description: Allowable, usable, or acceptable.

node.name: Wrong
node.description: Not accurate, correct, or appropriate.

node.name: Categorical-judgment
node.description: Categorical values that are based on the judgment or perception of the participant such familiar and famous.

node.name: Abnormal
node.description: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

node.name: Asymmetrical
node.description: Lacking symmetry or having parts that fail to correspond to one another in shape, size, or arrangement; lacking symmetry.

node.name: Congruent
node.description: Concordance of multiple evidence lines. In agreement or harmony.

node.name: Constrained
node.description: Keeping something within particular limits or bounds.

node.name: Disordered
node.description: Not neatly arranged; confused and untidy. A structural quality in which the parts of an object are non-rigid.

node.name: Familiar
node.description: Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.

node.name: Famous
node.description: A person who has a high degree of recognition by the general population for his or her success or accomplishments; a famous person.

node.name: Incongruent
node.description: Not in agreement or harmony.

node.name: Involuntary
node.description: An action that is not made by choice. In the body, involuntary actions (such as blushing) occur automatically, and cannot be controlled by choice.

node.name: Masked
node.description: Information exists but is not provided or is partially obscured due to security, privacy, or other concerns.

node.name: Normal
node.description: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

node.name: Ordered
node.description: Conforming to a logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements; a condition of regular or proper arrangement.

node.name: Symmetrical
node.description: Made up of exactly similar parts facing each other or around an axis; showing symmetry.

node.name: Unconstrained
node.description: Moving without restriction.

node.name: Unfamiliar
node.description: Not having knowledge or experience of.

node.name: Unmasked
node.description: Information is revealed.

node.name: Voluntary
node.description: Using free will or design; not forced or compelled; controlled by individual volition.

node.name: Categorical-level
node.description: Categorical values based on dividing a continuous variable into levels such as high and low.

node.name: Deep
node.description: Extending relatively far inward or downward.

node.name: High
node.description: Having an elevated level or position or degree; having a greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.

node.name: Liminal
node.description: Situated at a sensory threshold; barely perceptible or capable of eliciting a response.

node.name: Low
node.description: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.

node.name: Medium
node.description: Mid-way between small and large in number, quantity, magnitude or extent.

node.name: Negative
node.description: Involving disadvantage or harm.

node.name: Positive
node.description: Involving advantage or good.

node.name: Shallow
node.description: Having a depth which is relatively low.

node.name: Subliminal
node.description: Situated below a sensory threshold; imperceptible or not capable of eliciting a response.

node.name: Supraliminal
node.description: Situated above a sensory threshold; perceptible or capable of eliciting a response.

node.name: Thick
node.description: Wide in width, extent or cross-section.

node.name: Thin
node.description: Narrow in width, extent or cross-section.

node.name: Descriptive
node.description: Involving a written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

node.name: Abstract
node.description: A concept or idea not associated with any specific instance.

node.name: Clinical
node.description: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.

node.name: Complex
node.description: Hard, involved or complicated, elaborate, having many parts.

node.name: Composite
node.description: Consisting of separate interconnected parts.

node.name: Numerical
node.description: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

node.name: Symbolic
node.description: A representation such as a tattoo with a specific meaning. Significant purely in terms of what is being represented or implied.

node.name: Sensory
node.description: Relating to sensation or the physical senses; transmitted or perceived by the senses.

node.name: Auditory
node.description: Of or relating to the process of hearing.

node.name: Audible
node.description: Any action or condition designed to cause the registration or perception of a stimulus by organs and receptors involved in the sense of hearing.

node.name: Loudness
node.description: A physical quality inhering in a sound wave by virtue of the maximum magnitude (value without regard to sign) of its disturbance.

node.name: Monophonic
node.description: Relating to sound transmission, recording, or reproduction involving a single transmission path.

node.name: Silent
node.description: The absence of ambient audible sound, the emission of sounds of such low intensity that they do not draw attention to themselves, or the state of having ceased to produce sounds.

node.name: Stereophonic
node.description: Relating to, or constituting sound reproduction involving the use of separated microphones and two transmission channels to achieve the sound separation of a live hearing.

node.name: Timbre
node.description: The quality of tone distinctive of a particular singing voice or musical instrument.

node.name: Gustatory
node.description: Concerned with tasting or the sense of taste.

node.name: Bitter
node.description: Having a sharp, pungent taste.

node.name: Salty
node.description: Tasting of or like salt.

node.name: Savory
node.description: Belonging to a taste that is salty or spicy rather than sweet.

node.name: Sour
node.description: Having a sharp, acidic taste.

node.name: Sweet
node.description: Having or resembling the taste of sugar.

node.name: Tactile
node.description: Of or connected with the sense of touch.

node.name: Tactile-pressure
node.description: Having a feeling of heaviness.

node.name: Tactile-texture
node.description: Having a feeling of roughness.

node.name: Tactile-vibration
node.description: Having a feeling of mechanical oscillation.

node.name: Olfactory
node.description: Having to do with the faculty of smell.

node.name: Somatic
node.description: Having to do with feelings in the body.

node.name: Pain
node.description: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

node.name: Stress
node.description: The negative mental, emotional, and physical reactions that occur when environmental stressors are perceived as exceeding the adaptive capacities of the individual.

node.name: Vestibular
node.description: Relating to or affecting the perception of body position and movement.

node.name: Visual
node.description: Relating to or using sight; able to be seen.

node.name: Luminance
node.description: A quality that exists by virtue of the luminous intensity per unit area projected in a given direction.

node.name: Color
node.description: The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation.

node.name: Color-shade
node.description: A slight degree of difference between colors, especially with regard to how light or dark it is or as distinguished from one nearly like it.

node.name: Dark-shade
node.description: A color tone not reflecting much light.

node.name: Light-shade
node.description: A color tone reflecting more light.

node.name: HSV-color
node.description: A color representation that models how colors appear under light.

node.name: Hue
node.description: Attribute of a visual sensation according to which an area appears to be similar to one of the perceived colors.
Angular value between 0 and 360

node.name: Saturation
node.description: Colorfulness of a stimulus relative to its own brightness.
B value of RGB between 0 and 1

node.name: HSV-value
node.description: AAttribute of a visual sensation according to which an area appears to emit more or less light.
R value of RGB between 0 and 1
B value of RGB between 0 and 1
G value of RGB between 0 and 1

node.name: Grayscale
node.description: Using a color map composed of shades of gray, varying from black at the weakest intensity to white at the strongest.
White intensity between 0 and 1

node.name: CSS-color
node.description: One of 140 colors supported by all browsers. For more details such as the color RGB or HEX values, check: https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_groups.asp
